page.title: 02COAL EXTRACTION, UNSTONE.
page.content: In Sep. 1984 the National Coal Board began open-cast coaling at the Birch Hall site, marked on the O.S. Maps as Brierley Wood. The landscape is completely changed, huge piles of topsoil & overburden rising 30 or 40 metres, with the depth of excavation down to 35 metres. The total site area is 35 hectares. The coal excavation area is 19 hectares, the remaining areas being required for storage of the overburden, subsoil & topsoil. There are 30 men employed on the site. Coaling will be completed by the end of 1985, & the site restored by the spring of 1986. Planning permission exists for the construction of a golf course on the northern part.
